properties.short description: Peace Between Pope Honorius II and Count Roger II
properties.description: Fearing the desertion of his men, Pope Honorius II made a secret pact with Roger promising him the title of Duke in exchange for his homage.
properties.people:
Honorius II, Pope
Roger II, King
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Ravello and the Amalfitans Surrender to Roger II
properties.description: Once Ravello's tower was destroyed, the Amalfitans surrendered to Roger II.  Ravello, Scala, Agerola, and Pogerola submitted to Roger II's rule.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Sergius VII Surrenders to Roger II
properties.description: While Roger II was in Salerno, Sergius VII, Duke of Naples, surrendered Naples to Roger II.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Sergius VII, Duke of Naples
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Count Godfrey of Andria Surrenders to Roger II
properties.description: Fearing his inability to escape judicial punishment, Godfrey offered Roger II "a great part of his lands" to avoid a worse sentence.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Godfrey, Count of Andria
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Acerenza was Brought Under Roger II's Reign Peacefully
properties.description: Fearing an inability to besiege Acerenza, Roger II instead made peace.  The city restored power to Polutinus, who they had removed, as a result of the treaty.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Siege of Nocere is Lifted with Peace
properties.description: Roger II gains Nocere after threatening the town with a siege engine.  The peace agreement gave Nocere to Roger so long as he left the town unscathed.  Roger agreed and fulfilled the terms.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Ponte Immediately Surrenders to Roger II
properties.description: Upon witnessing Roger II's army, the town of Ponte immediately surrendered so as to be spared.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Baldwin, Baron of Ponte
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: The city of Capua surrendered to Roger II.  On threat of siege, Sergius VII gave himself over to Roger II and swore fealty.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Sergius VII, Duke of Naples
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Citizens begged Roger II to spare them.  He was given the city unconditionally and left it unharmed.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II received an unconditional surrender from the town after the first day of assault.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).
